p: Bipolaris gigantea inoculation did not significantly affect Microstegium biomass relative to the mock inoculation control ( Table 2). In addition, Microstegium biomass was not significantly different among treatments with different native species ( Table 2). Microstegium biomass increased with Microstegium density (0.16 g plant -1, 95% CI: 0.05 g plant -1â€“0.28 g plant -1) and the relationship between biomass and density varied in shape, although not significantly, when grown with the three species: saturating at high densities when grown with Dichanthelium ( Fig 4A), increasing nearly linearly when grown with Elymus ( Fig 4B), and peaking at intermediate densities when grown with Eragrostis ( Fig 4C).
